author: djrtwo
content:
Success in that it works and everyone on same chain

But some issues did arise that have been patched or are under investigation

the list (from my memory):
* teku made a bad block(s) -- issue self healed after 1 epoch and we know the problem. simple once found but tricky
* prysm launched without optimization flags and was seeing longer than expected times to produce block (think close to 1s instead of 300ms). optimizations are now deployed
* lighthouse was also seeing longer than expected block production times. not theory yet. australia went to sleep
* some very low sync committee blocks (e.g. 1% instead of 70%+)
* general lower than expected sync committee participation -- the missing bits are consistent block to block so seems like a systemic issue with a client or node rather than an issue with the algorithm. being investigated
